snippet: The recent deaths suggest that self-immolation is gaining favor as a form of political protest for Tibetan clergy.
abstract: Three Tibetan monks in central China set themselves on fire, raising to 15 the number of suicides in the last year by Buddhist clergy members protesting aspects of Beijing's rule in Tibet; deaths suggest that self-immolation is gaining favor as a form of political protest for Tibetan clergy.
lead_paragraph: The recent deaths suggest that self-immolation is gaining favor as a form of political protest for Tibetan clergy.

headline.seo: 3 Monks’ Deaths Show Rise of Self-Immolation Among Tibetans
headline.main: More Monks Die by Fire in Protest of Beijing
headline.print_headline: More Monks Die by Fire In Protest Of Beijing
